body.head.byline: By LESLIE KAUFMAN (NYT); Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: New York City will undertake advertising campaign on subway system and radio to urge people to pay more attention to child abuse (S)

block.p: City officials announced an advertising campaign yesterday that will urge people to pay more attention to child abuse. The campaign, using subway and radio advertisements, comes near the end of a year in which there have been more than half a dozen publicized deaths of children. The campaign, to begin in December, will consume half the advertising in 500 cars for 12 weeks. Posters will urge people to call 311 if they have good reason to suspect abuse, and will warn of possibly fatal actions.
